dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 755 IH: REAL ID Privacy Protection Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Sanford (for himself, Mr. Meadows, and Ms. Pingree) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To amend the REAL ID Act of 2005 to remove the provision requiring each State to provide all other States with electronic access to information contained in the motor vehicle database of the State, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the REAL ID Privacy Protection Act.

section.header: Improvements relating to REAL ID Act of 2005

subsection.header: Removal of requirement relating to retention of source documents and electronic access to the motor vehicle database of each State
subsection.text: Section 202(d) of the REAL ID Act of 2005 (Public Law 109–13; 49 U.S.C. 30301 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (3) through (11) as paragraphs (2) through (10), respectively; and

subsection.text: If any State is not in compliance with the requirements under section 202 of the REAL ID Act of 2005, has received a limited extension of the deadline for compliance, or is under review for compliance as of the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Homeland Security shall grant such State an extension of the deadline for compliance through October 10, 2017.

subsection.header: Report relating to material compliance checklist for REAL ID Act of 2005
subsection.text: Not later than 30 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Homeland Security shall submit a report to Congress that—

paragraph.text: describes the requirements of the material compliance checklist for the REAL ID Act of 2005, which is established and maintained by the Secretary;
describes whether and how each State complies with each requirement of the material compliance checklist; and
based on the information provided under paragraph (2), includes a justification for the status of each State with respect to compliance with the requirements of the REAL ID Act of 2005.

subsection.text: In this section, the term State has the meaning given that term in section 201 of the REAL ID Act of 2005.
